p: The analysis of the chemical composition of essential oils isolated from Z. mezoneurispinosum organs revealed 15 compounds for the leaves, 19 compounds for the trunk bark, and 27 compounds for the roots. These compounds represent more than 99.9% of each essential oilâ€™s overall composition ( Table 1). The essential oils isolated from the trunk bark and from the leaves were predominantly composed of monoterpenes (83.3% and 92.1%, respectively). Sesquiterpenes represented 16.7% and 7.9% of the composition of the trunk bark oil and the leaf oil, respectively. The essential oil isolated from the roots was mainly composed of sesquiterpenes (81.5%) and monoterpenes (18.6%).
